txt.en: '[placeholder], this is a trap! Drostan and Avair together....'
Instance: The Rite of Clúcath
'I will get help, Chieftain. Do not let them do this!'
'Death will find you swiftly!'
'We have arrived, and before the Trév Duvárdain.'
'Wait. They approach.'
'[placeholder] is the warrior who took the Stone of Clúcath from the Cairn of Honour.'
'Cána! Bring word to Aughaire: I will stand with [placeholder]!'
'I thought about what you said to me, [placeholder], and I have reached a decision.'
'I am defeated! Finish me!'

'Are you prepared, [placeholder]? The rite of Clúcath will determine the fortunes of the Trév Gállorg, but we must be on guard: Domongart has been treacherous in the past, and there is small reason to expect that today will be different.\n\n'But if you are victorious, it will mean much. It must be chanced.'

'The Trév Gállorg have triumphed, [placeholder]! You have brought victory to Fail-á-Khro, where sorrow has reigned too long.\n\n'Speak with me when you are ready to return to Aughaire, and we will go.'
'Pride must not blind me to your friendship. I will stand by you in this and defend you if I may.'
'We will return to Aughaire in triumph, [placeholder]. When we left it, we left in doubt. We return now with the certainty of victory.'
'We will return to Aughaire in triumph, [placeholder]. When we left it, we left in doubt; we return now with the certainty of victory.'
You have been victorious in the rite of Clúcath
'I will fight alongside you, [placeholder].'
'You are a southron and our problems are not yours, but still you fight for us.'
'I stand with you.'
'We are almost to Fail-á-Khro.'
'I am no coward. I do not shy from your feeble protestations of strength.'
'For the Trév Gállorg!'
'We will have Clúcath, but with two changes.'
You have come to Fail-á-Khro to engage in the ceremonial rite of Clúcath on behalf of the Trév Gállorg.
'There will be two warriors. Both Drostan and Avair will fight for the Trév Duvárdain.'
'What is your second demand?'
'The combat will be to the death. The Trév Duvárdain do not engage in the mock battles of children.'
'So be it.'
'Drostan, Avair...kill them!'
'I will kill you as I killed Násan!'
Walk with Crannog to Fail-á-Khro
'No.'
'Finish me, you coward! You are spineless!'
Talk to Crannog
'Let them keep their lives. Such is the law of Clúcath.'
Watch the Clúcath unfold
Defeat the warriors of the Trév Duvárdain
'It seems my choice of warriors was poor.'
'Cána! Be still!'
'Kill them.'
'We will not. They will live.'
'We accept. [placeholder] will fight for the Trév Gállorg.'
'I know all about the southron, Crannog. I am not impressed.'
'Then you are weak and deserve their company.'
'That is the law of Clúcath.'
'Our friends in Carn Dûm will crush you at the slightest of words from me.'
'I no longer count Avair or Drostan among the Trév Duvárdain and strip them of their names.'
'The Trév Duvárdain do not need to respond to your invocation of Clúcath.'
Crannog is waiting to walk with you to the site where the Clúcath will be performed.
The Clúcath is about to begin: Crannog of the Trév Gállorg and Domongart of the Trév Duvárdain are face-to-face.
The Clúcath has begun, but the rules of the rite have not been followed! You must now fight to defend yourself against the enemy, for there will be no mercy.
Crannog is at Fail-á-Khro, waiting to congratulate you on your victory.\n\nYou have been victorious in Clúcath and should speak now with Crannog.
'For Aughaire and my people!'
'Leave me be! I have no need of your sympathy! I curse the Trév Gállorg, and you most of all, fool [placeholder]!'

'I do not understand, [placeholder]. Why did you spare me? What have I to live for, now that I have been cast from the Trév Duvárdain and my name taken? I am Drostan no longer...but who shall I be now?'
'My heart is at ease, [placeholder]. My father has been avenged, and I have upheld the principles of the Trév Gállorg and of Clúcath. I owe you much.'
'You fought well and bravely, [placeholder]. It was an honour to stand with you.'
'The Trév Gállorg show mercy, even to you and yours, Domongart.'
'No. Their lives will be spared.'
'That is the law of Clúcath.'
Instance: The Rite of Clúcath
'You are frightened of us! You are spineless, Domongart!'
